Last night, another combined missile and drone attack was carried out on the city of Kremenchuk, Poltava Oblast.
Among the targets hit were the main power plant and the oil refinery. NASA FIRMS picked up a large fire burning at the refinery, despite heavy cloud cover over the city.
3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were launched from the vicinity of Kursk City, Kursk Oblast - one of which was equipped with a cluster warhead. The Iskanders likely targeted the refinery.
Approximately 50 Geran-2 drones were also used. They likely primarily targeted energy infrastructure. 
(Credit to "
Intel Cams | OSINT
" on YouTube for the first clip)

Last night, another combined missile and drone attack was carried out on the city of Kremenchuk, Poltava Oblast.
Among the targets hit were the main power plant and the oil refinery. NASA FIRMS picked up a large fire burning at the refinery, despite heavy cloud cover over the city.
3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were launched from the vicinity of Kursk City, Kursk Oblast - one of which was equipped with a cluster warhead. The Iskanders likely targeted the refinery.
Approximately 50 Geran-2 drones were also used. They likely primarily targeted energy infrastructure. 
(Credit to "
Intel Cams | OSINT
" on YouTube for the first clip)

Overnight, around 8 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked energy infrastructure in Odesa City.
The target was likely the "Centrolit" 220 kV electrical substation (46.61796, 30.82342). A large fire subsequently broke out, resulting in power outages for parts of northern Odesa.

Overnight, around 8 Russian Geran-2 drones attacked energy infrastructure in Odesa City.
The target was likely the "Centrolit" 220 kV electrical substation (46.61796, 30.82342). A large fire subsequently broke out, resulting in power outages for parts of northern Odesa.

Over the last few days, the defence of Siversk has completely collapsed. 
A fortress city that the Russians couldn't reach for nearly 4 years is about to be captured after just a week of fighting.
If this isn't a sign of how bad Ukraine's manpower shortages have got, I don't know what is.

- Cambodian forces also launched a counterattack in the village of Trakoun, Poi Pet direction.
Footage shows Cambodian troops crossing a recently planted Thai barbed wire point, as well as taking down the Thai flag, replacing it with a Cambodian one. Most of the village is under Cambodian control.

The last Ukrainian defences in the besieged city of Myrnohrad are being breached by Russian forces, who have now entered the city centre. 
The parts of the pocket still under firm Ukrainian control have decreased to around 2.8 km¬≤, compared to ~36 km¬≤ at the beginning of the siege. 
Nevertheless, Russian FAB glide-bombs continue to strike the remaining blocks still under Ukrainian control. This video shows a FAB-1500 strike on a high-rise apartment building.
Iskander launch from Taganrog, Rostov Oblast
Iskander launch from Taganrog, Rostov Oblast
No missiles have been detected in Ukrainian airspace. Possibly the work of Russian air defence.

Russian forces have captured the village of Synkivka, Kupyansk direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~389.
Total land area: ~1.64 km¬≤.
The fighting for Synkivka lasted approximately 2 years, 5 months.

Russian forces have captured the village of Lyman, Bilyi Kolodyaz direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~542.
Total land area: ~1.93 km¬≤.
The fighting for Lyman lasted approximately 16 days.
1 Tu-95MS strategic bomber just carried out a launch maneuver over Penza Oblast while redeploying from Olenya Airbase to Engels-2 Airbase.
Iskander threat from Bryansk Oblast
1 Tu-95MS strategic bomber just carried out a launch maneuver over Penza Oblast while redeploying from Olenya Airbase to Engels-2 Airbase.

The launch maneuvers were carried out 10 minutes ago.
If they were real, Kh-101 cruise missiles should enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 40 minutes.
Remember, last time there was a missile attack, additional launches were carried out at around this time.

I wrote about this during the previous attack, and I am doing it again now because its become clear. In recent strikes, Russia has clearly changed its tactics for carrying out large scale missile attacks on Ukraine involving Tu-95MS/Tu-160M strategic bombers. 
For the past 3 to 4 years, Olenya Air Base served as the main base for combat flights, with bombers taking off from there ahead of any strike. Dyagilevo and Engels 2 were also used in combat strikes.
Now the pattern has changed. Bombers take off directly from the Far East already ready for combat and fly towards launch zones in western Russia, where they launch cruise missiles at Ukraine. After that, the aircraft land at Engels 2 to refuel and rearm before returning to the Far East.

Unidentified missile in Sumy Oblast

This was Russian S-300/400 air defence targeting Ukrainian fighter jets

Russian Offensive In Kharkiv Gains Momentum With Capture Of Liman (Videos)
On December 11, the Russian military expanded its control in the direction of Vovchansk in Kharkiv, capturing the settlement of Liman from Kiev forces.
The Russian Ministry of Defense confirmed the capture of Liman, located to the southeast of Vovchans, by the Sever [North] Group of Forces in a brief statement. The settlement is among the largest near Vovchansk and together with Synelnykove, it formed one of Ukraine‚Äôs main defense lines around the city.
The Sever Group of Forces captured Synelnykove in November, before defeating Kiev forces in Vovchansk itself earlier this month.
The capture of Liman now signals the start of a Ukrainian collapse to the east and southeast of Vovchans, as the Russian offensive there is gaining momentum.
üëâ

Massive Ukrainian Drone Raid Targets Moscow. Russian Strikes Crush Ukraine's Power Grid
On the night of December 10-11, Russia and Ukraine continued their intense exchange of strikes targeting each other's critical infrastructure. According to the Ukrainian Air Force, 154 air attack assets were launched across the country: 151 strike drones and 3 Iskander-M/KN-23 ballistic missiles, of which 83 drones and 2 missiles were downed or suppressed.
The primary Russian strike package targeted Ukrainian¬†energy and fuel sector facilities. The¬†epicenter of the attack was Kremenchuk in the Poltava region, where impacts, including from ballistic missiles, caused fires at an oil refinery and reportedly affected the Kremenchuk Hydroelectric Power Plant. 
In Fastiv, Kyiv region, railway hubs were hit again. Due to extensive damage to the energy grid, operator DTEK announced unprecedented 17-hour scheduled power outages in Kyiv.
üëâ

Russian Troops Are Storming Eastern Part Of Huliaipole (Videos)
On December 11, the Russian military stormed the eastern part of the key city of Huliaipole after breaking through Ukrainian defenses there.
The breakthrough saw several formations from the Vostoke [East] Group of Forces crossing the Haichur River and taking control of Peschanya Street. Later, Russian troops begin expanding their control in the eastern part of the city by attacking Mira and Velikaya streets.
Kiev forces, which were shocked by the breakthrough, are currently attempting to organize new defense lines in Sverdlova Street and nearby buildings at the junction of Mira and Lenina Street.
üëâ

Russian Successes In Kharkiv: Ukraine Lost Liman And More
The Russian command announced that they have established full control over Siversk. In the Kharkiv sector, Russian units have taken control of Liman.
A meeting of senior officials from the United States, Ukraine, France, Germany, and Great Britain is scheduled in Paris to discuss the Donald Trump administration's peace plan.
